CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 26 The LUMO energy levels of the polymers were determined by combining the HOMO energy levels obtained from CV and the optical bandgap energies obtained from the edges of absorption.

Let's think step by step.

1. Polymers

The term "polymers" is a type of material, specifically organic compounds made up of repeating structural units called monomers. In this context, it is the material whose LUMO (Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital) energy levels are being discussed.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 26 The LUMO energy levels of the polymers were determined by combining the HOMO energy levels obtained from CV and the optical bandgap energies obtained from the edges of absorption.

Let's think step by step.

1. LUMO energy levels: This is a property of polymers, specifically related to their electronic structure. It represents the energy level of the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital.
2. HOMO energy levels: This is another property of polymers, also related to their electronic structure. It represents the energy level of the highest occupied molecular orbital.
3. Optical bandgap energies: This is a property of polymers, related to their optical properties. It represents the energy required to promote an electron from the valence band to the conduction band when light is absorbed.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. LUMO energy levels (property of polymers)
2. HOMO energy levels (property of polymers)
3. Optical bandgap energies (property of polymers)

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| LUMO energy levels of polymers |
| HOMO energy levels of polymers |
| Optical bandgap energies of polymers |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 26 The LUMO energy levels of the polymers were determined by combining the HOMO energy levels obtained from CV and the optical bandgap energies obtained from the edges of absorption.

Let's think step by step.

1. LUMO energy levels of the polymers: This is a property value representing the energy level of the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital in the polymers.
2. HOMO energy levels obtained from CV: This is a property value representing the energy level of the highest occupied molecular orbital in the polymers, obtained from cyclic voltammetry measurements.
3. Optical bandgap energies obtained from the edges of absorption: This is a property value representing the energy difference between the valence band and the conduction band in the polymers, determined from the absorption edges in the optical spectrum.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. LUMO energy levels of the polymers: 26.1 eV (assuming a value for illustration purpose)
2. HOMO energy levels obtained from CV: 5.1 eV (assuming a value for illustration purpose)
3. Optical bandgap energies: 3.5 eV (assuming a value for illustration purpose)

Note: The actual values would depend on the specific polymers being referred to in the paragraph.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| LUMO energy levels of the polymers |
| HOMO energy levels obtained from CV |
| Optical bandgap energies obtained from the edges of absorption |

| Value |
|-------|
| 26.1 eV (for LUMO energy levels of the polymers) |
| 5.1 eV (for HOMO energy levels obtained from CV) |
| 3.5 eV (for Optical bandgap energies obtained from the edges of absorption) |

Note: The actual values would depend on the specific polymers being referred to in the paragraph.
